title: Walmart's Giant Presidents' Day Sale Has So Many Editor-Loved Kitchen Finds
description: Score the Ninja CREAMi and more for less. READ MORE...
author: Morgan Pryor
excerpt: Score the Ninja CREAMi and more for less.
text: Kitchen & HomeSales & DealsMorgan PryorCommerce Assistant EditorI cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.published nowWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.With Valentine’s Day around the corner, you might not have realized that Presidents’ Day is coming up, too. If you’re lucky, you’re getting the day off on Monday to relax. (I, for one, am going to be catching up on sleep.) During that downtime, you should definitely make a point to check out all of the sales that brands are putting on for the holiday. HexClad, Zwilling, Momofuku, KitchenAid, and countless more have already dropped a ton of deals.1 / 10Walmart$34.96was $39.96If you want to cut your meal prep time in half, this stunning air fryer from Drew Barrymore is key. “I’ve made everything from pork chops (which came out so juicy) and chicken breasts to cookies, and even — focaccia,” says our review of the dual compartment version. “In short, the foolproof auto settings basically make me feel like a pro chef. Best of all, the cleanup is seamless, too. The removable, non-stick air crisper trays are dishwasher-safe, so you can forget about hand-scrubbing them.”2 / 10Walmart$54.99was $199.99This versatile cookware set is a favorite of commerce shopping writer Nikol, who calls out their cute look and smart design in her review. “They really are nonstick, regardless of whether you clean them right after use or soak them in soap and warm water first,” she adds. “It goes without saying that storage is also a breeze, as the pans take up minimal space once stacked inside one another.”3 / 10Walmart$22.99was $49.99Tiny kitchen owners know that you have to make the most of every cabinet — and shelf risers are key. Commerce editor Britt chose these for their stylish design and was even more impressed when it wrangled her large mug collection. Each shelf can hold over 30 pounds, so you can stack plenty of plates or gadgets, too.4 / 10Walmart$139.99was $159.00In the mornings, sometimes you don’t have time to spare to brew a cup of coffee, particularly if you have a complicated machine. That’s why you should make the switch to the editor-loved Nespresso Vertuo Plus, which uses capsules and makes a café-quality drink at the press of a button. “My Nespresso infuses a bright spot into my morning day after day, and I wouldn’t trade it for anything,” our tester writes.5 / 10Walmart$169.00was $199.00Homemade ice cream just hits differently than storebought pints — but you don’t have to expend a ton of effort churning a batch by hand. The mega-popular Ninja CREAMi, Britt can confirm, makes the process so easy. And you can make it with all of your favorite add-ins! “As someone who’s made grocery runs specifically for ice cream, it’s saved me lots of gas and money, which is just another plus in my book!” Britt’s review says.6 / 10Walmart$44.84was $49.88A Dutch oven is an essential in every kitchen for meal prepping and making cozy soups during the winter months. It’s also so durable for the price: “I’ve dropped the lid from about 12 inches, I’m never gentle about plopping it on the stovetop, and I’ve even accidentally left an entire circular lasagna inside of it — unrefrigerated — for 10 days while I was on vacation in Ireland,” says one of our former editors. “When I came home, I scraped it out and cleaned it with virtually no hassle.”7 / 10Walmart$79.00was $98.00This Ninja blender is another meal prep superhero, according to commerce writer Micki. “Beyond its compact size, what I really love about the Ninja TWISTi is how effectively it cuts through ice and frozen fruit,” she explains in her review, also noting that it offers the same amount of power as Vitamix’s new Ascent X Series.8 / 10Walmart$429.90was $519.99I don’t know about you, but out of all of the areas in my apartment, my vacuum sees the most action in my kitchen. If you want to make easy work out of cleaning up messes and spills, then this Dyson will do the trick. “The Dyson V8 Absolute may be slim and sleek, but its incredibly powerful suction picks up everything from hairballs and extra-large dust bunnies to tiny specks of dirt, crumbs, and slimy onion skin,” our tester says, adding that the parts are washable so no smells linger.9 / 10Walmart$279.99was $359.00I can’t imagine baking without my KitchenAid stand mixer ever again — and I also use it for a variety of other kitchen tasks at this point, including making ice cream with an extra attachment. Available in four gorgeous colors, this mixer’s bowl has 10 speeds and a 4.5-quart capacity for making large batches at once.10 / 10Walmart$59.00was $69.00This appliance earned a spot on our list of the best toaster ovens on the market. “I used this recently at a friend’s house; we put it on the air fryer setting and threw in half a bag of sweet potato fries,” says our former lifestyle director. “They came out super crispy. While air fryers are not THAT different from countertop convection ovens, the wire basket in this toaster really makes a difference.”My Kitchn HelperGet our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Kitchen & Home
  • Sales & Deals

Morgan PryorCommerce Assistant Editor

I cover must-have home products, sales, and brand launches. Prior to working at ATM, I earned my degree in Culture Writing and Criticism from NYU, and I interned at publications like CNN Underscored, TV Insider, Texas Monthly (I'm a Dallas native), and more. When I'm not writing, I'm usually at the movies or browsing in a thrift store.

published now

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

With Valentine’s Day around the corner, you might not have realized that Presidents’ Day is coming up, too. If you’re lucky, you’re getting the day off on Monday to relax. (I, for one, am going to be catching up on sleep.) During that downtime, you should definitely make a point to check out all of the sales that brands are putting on for the holiday. HexClad, Zwilling, Momofuku, KitchenAid, and countless more have already dropped a ton of deals.

1 / 10

Walmart

$34.96

was $39.96

If you want to cut your meal prep time in half, this stunning air fryer from Drew Barrymore is key. “I’ve made everything from pork chops (which came out so juicy) and chicken breasts to cookies, and even — focaccia,” says our review of the dual compartment version. “In short, the foolproof auto settings basically make me feel like a pro chef. Best of all, the cleanup is seamless, too. The removable, non-stick air crisper trays are dishwasher-safe, so you can forget about hand-scrubbing them.”

2 / 10

Walmart

$54.99

was $199.99

This versatile cookware set is a favorite of commerce shopping writer Nikol, who calls out their cute look and smart design in her review. “They really are nonstick, regardless of whether you clean them right after use or soak them in soap and warm water first,” she adds. “It goes without saying that storage is also a breeze, as the pans take up minimal space once stacked inside one another.”

3 / 10

Walmart

$22.99

was $49.99

Tiny kitchen owners know that you have to make the most of every cabinet — and shelf risers are key. Commerce editor Britt chose these for their stylish design and was even more impressed when it wrangled her large mug collection. Each shelf can hold over 30 pounds, so you can stack plenty of plates or gadgets, too.

4 / 10

Walmart

$139.99

was $159.00

In the mornings, sometimes you don’t have time to spare to brew a cup of coffee, particularly if you have a complicated machine. That’s why you should make the switch to the editor-loved Nespresso Vertuo Plus, which uses capsules and makes a café-quality drink at the press of a button. “My Nespresso infuses a bright spot into my morning day after day, and I wouldn’t trade it for anything,” our tester writes.

5 / 10

Walmart

$169.00

was $199.00

Homemade ice cream just hits differently than storebought pints — but you don’t have to expend a ton of effort churning a batch by hand. The mega-popular Ninja CREAMi, Britt can confirm, makes the process so easy. And you can make it with all of your favorite add-ins! “As someone who’s made grocery runs specifically for ice cream, it’s saved me lots of gas and money, which is just another plus in my book!” Britt’s review says.

6 / 10

Walmart

$44.84

was $49.88

A Dutch oven is an essential in every kitchen for meal prepping and making cozy soups during the winter months. It’s also so durable for the price: “I’ve dropped the lid from about 12 inches, I’m never gentle about plopping it on the stovetop, and I’ve even accidentally left an entire circular lasagna inside of it — unrefrigerated — for 10 days while I was on vacation in Ireland,” says one of our former editors. “When I came home, I scraped it out and cleaned it with virtually no hassle.”

7 / 10

Walmart

$79.00

was $98.00

This Ninja blender is another meal prep superhero, according to commerce writer Micki. “Beyond its compact size, what I really love about the Ninja TWISTi is how effectively it cuts through ice and frozen fruit,” she explains in her review, also noting that it offers the same amount of power as Vitamix’s new Ascent X Series.

8 / 10

Walmart

$429.90

was $519.99

I don’t know about you, but out of all of the areas in my apartment, my vacuum sees the most action in my kitchen. If you want to make easy work out of cleaning up messes and spills, then this Dyson will do the trick. “The Dyson V8 Absolute may be slim and sleek, but its incredibly powerful suction picks up everything from hairballs and extra-large dust bunnies to tiny specks of dirt, crumbs, and slimy onion skin,” our tester says, adding that the parts are washable so no smells linger.

9 / 10

Walmart

$279.99

was $359.00

I can’t imagine baking without my KitchenAid stand mixer ever again — and I also use it for a variety of other kitchen tasks at this point, including making ice cream with an extra attachment. Available in four gorgeous colors, this mixer’s bowl has 10 speeds and a 4.5-quart capacity for making large batches at once.

10 / 10

Walmart

$59.00

was $69.00

This appliance earned a spot on our list of the best toaster ovens on the market. “I used this recently at a friend’s house; we put it on the air fryer setting and threw in half a bag of sweet potato fries,” says our former lifestyle director. “They came out super crispy. While air fryers are not THAT different from countertop convection ovens, the wire basket in this toaster really makes a difference.”

My Kitchn Helper

Get our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
